channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16447] Replication by namespaces config in peer
item.description:
Now we only config table cfs in peer. But in our production cluster, there are a dozen of namespace and every namespace has dozens of tables. It was complicated to config all table cfs in peer. For some namespace, it need replication all tables to other slave cluster. It will be easy to config if we support replication by namespace. Suggestions and discussions are welcomed.

Review board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/51521/
item.summary: Replication by namespaces config in peer

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Upload a v1 patch.

Take a look about the unit test report. But i don't know it means what...... This patch didn't change this ut "test_add_peer:_should_fail_when_args_isn't_specified".


org.jruby.embed.EvalFailedException: (RuntimeError) test_add_peer:_should_fail_when_args_isn't_specified is already defined in Hbase::ReplicationAdminTest
Enis Soztutar Ted Yu Any ideas about v3 patch?
Upload v4. Update by review comments. Meanwhile, change the namespaceZNode to non static in ZooKeeperWatcher. When it is static, the ut which start 2 mini cluster has same namespaceZNode.

Thanks. I try to generate a patch for branch-1. But I found that HBASE-11393 was not merged to branch-1. The table-cfs config and namespace:table use the same colon separator. So we can't add table like "ns1:table1" to the peer config and only add table in default namespace. I thought we should fix this first in all branches which support namespaces.
Cool. I'll resolve this then. We can open a separate issue for backporting HBASE-11393 and this if needed.
HBASE-11386 is about this bug when table name contains namespace.
Thanks. Left a comment there.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Support replication by namespaces config in peer.
1. Set a namespace in peer config means that all tables in this namespace will be replicated.
2. If the namespaces config is null, then the table-cfs config decide which table's edit can be replicated. If the table-cfs config is null, then the namespaces config decide which table's edit can be replicated.
3. If you already have set a namespace in the peer config, then you can't set any table of this namespace to the peer config. If you already have set a table in the peer config, then you can't set this table's namespace to the peer config.
